nodes.bodyText: these are both a bit sketchy cases where compiler should have issued lint message warning: non-varargs call of varargs method with inexact argument type for last parameter;

+
+class ObjectsHashCodeUnnecessaryVarargsTest {
+
+    @Test
+    public void test() {
+        fix().addInputLines(
+                        "Test.java",
+                        "import java.util.Objects;",
+                        "public class Test {",
+                        "  void f(Object a, Object[] b, String[] c) {",
+                        "    Objects.hash(a);",
+                        "    Objects.hash(a, a);",
+                        "    Objects.hash(b);",

nodes.bodyText: Should Object[] be treated differently than other object type array such as String[] in this case? I'm a little worried this might be papering over some other potential issues where something should be using Arrays.hashCode directly on an array.
